title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: First, execute Single Site, Exploratory analyses, configured appropriately study, data source. function produce 2 tables. Select first table list result set, combine results single table different sites delineated site column. also need edit output_function column reflect table now considered Multi Site, Exploratory output.
code: library(sensitivityselectioncriteria)  my_table <- ssc_process(base_cohort = my_cohort,                         alt_cohorts = list('My Alternate Cohort' = my_alt_cohort),                         omop_or_pcornet = 'omop',                         multi_or_single_site = 'single',                         anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory',                         ...) my_final_results <- my_table1[[1]] %>% dplyr::union(my_table2[[1]]) ... %>%   dplyr::union(my_table_n[[1]]) %>%   dplyr::mutate(output_function = 'ssc_ms_exp_cs')

title: Multi-Site Analysis for Independent Data Sources
text: slightly complex reproduce anomaly detection analysis case, due level summarization output typical function. Instead running ssc_process normally , need use internal function produce correct results. first step run appropriate internal function, depending CDM using, data sources. intakes parameters primary ssc_process function. function executed data source, combine results single table different sites delineated site column. , pass combined table anomaly detection function execute standardized mean difference computation. provided custom demographic mappings, extract demographic labels file. Otherwise, use appropriate package-provided table based data model (either ssc_omop_demographics ssc_pcornet_demographics). also need edit output_function column reflect table now considered Multi Site, Anomaly Detection output.
code: ## For an OMOP CDM: my_omop_table <-    sensitivityselectioncriteria:::compare_cohort_def_omop(                                     base_cohort = my_cohort,                                     alt_cohorts = list('My Alternate Cohort' = my_alt_cohort),                                     multi_or_single_site = 'single',                                     ...)  ## For a PCORnet CDM: my_pcornet_table <-    sensitivityselectioncriteria:::compare_cohort_def_pcnt(                                     base_cohort = my_cohort,                                     alt_cohorts = list('My Alternate Cohort' = my_alt_cohort),                                     multi_or_single_site = 'single',                                     ...) my_combo_results <- my_table1 %>% dplyr::union(my_table2) ... %>%   dplyr::union(my_table_n) my_final_results <-    sensitivityselectioncriteria:::compare_cohort_smd(cohort_def_output = my_combo_results,                                                     demographic_vector =                                                        my_demographic_table %>%                                                         select(demographic) %>% pull()) %>%   dplyr::mutate(output_function = 'ssc_ms_anom_cs')

title: Reformat cohort definition tables — compare_cohort_def_omop
text: Reformat cohort definition tables

title: Reformat cohort definition tables — compare_cohort_def_omop
code: compare_cohort_def_omop(   base_cohort,   alt_cohorts,   multi_or_single_site,   person_tbl = cdm_tbl("person"),   visit_tbl = cdm_tbl("visit_occurrence"),   provider_tbl = NULL,   care_site_tbl = NULL,   demographic_mappings = sensitivityselectioncriteria::ssc_omop_demographics,   specialty_concepts = NULL,   outcome_concepts = NULL,   domain_defs = sensitivityselectioncriteria::ssc_domain_file,   domain_select = sensitivityselectioncriteria::ssc_domain_file %>% distinct(domain)     %>% pull() )

title: Reformat cohort definition tables — compare_cohort_def_omop
text: base_cohort table base cohort & inclusion criteria; must include site, person_id, start_date, end_date alt_cohorts list table alternative inclusion criteria definition applied base_cohort multi_or_single_site direction determine kind check run string either multi single person_tbl CDM table contains patient information visit_tbl CDM table contains visit/encounter information provider_tbl CDM table provider & provider specialty information used specialty_concepts provided provider_tbl & care_site_tbl null, provider specialty prioritized care_site_tbl CDM table care site / facility & care site / facility specialty information used specialty_concepts provided provider_tbl & care_site_tbl null, provider specialty prioritized demographic_mappings table defining demographic elements defined NULL, default demographic mappings CDM used (ssc_omop_demographics) otherwise, user provided table used specialty_concepts concept set provider specialty concepts interest used identify specialty visits outcome_concepts concept set following columns: concept_id | concept_code | concept_name | vocabulary_id | variable | domain   domain_defs table domain definitions following columns: domain, domain_tbl, concept_field, date_field, filter_logic domain_select vector domain names used computation facts per domain per year follow
code: where domain matches a domain listed in the `domain_defs` table this vector does NOT need to include domains used in the computation for                  outcomes, as those will be accessed from the table directly

title: Reformat cohort definition tables — compare_cohort_def_omop
text: one combined dataframe one row per patient original cohort flags show cohort definitions apply patient.
code: flag columns will include `base_cohort` and `alt_cohort_#` columns with numbers     appended that correspond to the tables position in the `def_tbls` list      `base_cohort` should equal 1 for all patients

code: ssc_domain_file

title: SSC Sample Domain File — ssc_domain_file
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 2 rows 6 columns.

title: SSC Sample Domain File — ssc_domain_file
text: #' @format ## ssc_domain_file domain arbitrary string label domain interest domain_tbl name CDM table associated domain interest concept_field name column domain table contains concepts interest listed concept_set file. date_field name column domain table contains dates used time-based filtering. vocabulary_field (PCORnet ) name column domain table vocabulary type stored filter_logic (optional) string parsed logic filter domain_tbl needed best represent domain

text: two bump charts - one continuous facts (represented medians) another categorical facts (represented proportions) two alternate cohort definitions provided, base cohort placed middle plot. Otherwise, base left.

what: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – Output Generation — ssc_output
title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – Output Generation — ssc_output
text: Using tabular output generated ssc_process, function build graph visualize results. function configuration output bespoke ggplot. Theming can adjusted user graph output using + theme(). graphs can also made interactive using make_interactive_squba()

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – Output Generation — ssc_output
code: ssc_output(   process_output,   alt_cohort_filter = NULL,   large_n = FALSE,   large_n_sites = NULL )

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – Output Generation — ssc_output
text: process_output tabular input || required tabular output produced ssc_process alt_cohort_filter string vector || defaults NULL vector names alternate cohorts display output. limited 2 less maintain good visibility graph. parameter required following check types: Single Site, Exploratory, Cross-Sectional Multi-Site, Exploratory, Cross-Sectional large_n boolean || defaults FALSE Multi-Site analyses, boolean indicating whether large N visualization, intended high volume sites, used. visualization produce high level summaries across sites, option add specific site comparators via large_n_sites parameter. large_n_sites vector || defaults NULL large_n = TRUE, vector site names can add site-level information plot comparison across high level summary information.

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – Output Generation — ssc_output
text: function produce graph visualize results ssc_process based parameters provided. default output typically static ggplot gt object, interactive elements can activated passing plot make_interactive_squba. detailed description output specific check type, see PEDSpace metadata repository

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – Output Generation — ssc_output
code:
#' Source setup file source(system.file('setup.R', package = 'sensitivityselectioncriteria')) #' Create in-memory RSQLite database using data in extdata directory conn <- mk_testdb_omop() #' Establish connection to database and generate internal configurations initialize_dq_session(session_name = 'ssc_process_test', working_directory = my_directory, db_conn = conn, is_json = FALSE, file_subdirectory = my_file_folder, cdm_schema = NA) #> Connected to: :memory:@NA #> To see environment settings, run `get_argos_default()` ## silence SQL trace for this example config('db_trace', FALSE) #' Build mock base study cohort base_cohort <- cdm_tbl('person') %>% dplyr::distinct(person_id) %>% dplyr::mutate(start_date = as.Date(-5000), #RSQLite does not store date objects, #hence the numerics end_date = as.Date(15000), site = ifelse(person_id %in% c(1:6), 'synth1', 'synth2')) #' Build mock alternate study cohort alt_cohort <- cdm_tbl('person') %>% dplyr::distinct(person_id) %>% head(100) %>% dplyr::mutate(start_date = as.Date(-5000), #RSQLite does not store date objects, #hence the numerics end_date = as.Date(15000), site = ifelse(person_id %in% c(1:6), 'synth1', 'synth2')) #' Prepare input tables ssc_domain_tbl <- dplyr::tibble(domain = c('all conditions', 'outpatient visits'), domain_tbl = c('condition_occurrence', 'visit_occurrence'), concept_field = c('condition_concept_id', 'visit_concept_id'), date_field = c('condition_start_date', 'visit_start_date'), vocabulary_field = c(NA, NA), filter_logic = c(NA, 'visit_concept_id == 9202')) ssc_outcome_tbl <- read_codeset('dx_hypertension') %>% dplyr::mutate(variable = 'hypertension', domain = 'all conditions') #' Execute `ssc_process` function #' This example will use the single site, exploratory, cross sectional #' configuration ssc_process_example <- ssc_process(base_cohort = base_cohort, alt_cohorts = list('Sample Alternate' = alt_cohort), omop_or_pcornet = 'omop', multi_or_single_site = 'single', anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory', domain_tbl = ssc_domain_tbl, domain_select = c('all conditions', 'outpatient visits'), outcome_concepts = ssc_outcome_tbl) %>% suppressMessages() #> Warning: Missing values are always removed in SQL aggregation functions. #> Use `na.rm = TRUE` to silence this warning #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> ┌ Output Function Details ──────────────────────────────────────┐ #> │ You can optionally use this dataframe in the accompanying │ #> │ `ssc_output` function. Here are the parameters you will need: │ #> │ │ #> │ Always Required: process_output │ #> │ Required for Check: alt_cohort_filter │ #> │ │ #> │ See ?ssc_output for more details. │ #> └───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ssc_process_example #> $summary_values #> # A tibble: 28 × 7 #> site cohort_id cohort_characteristic fact_group fact_summary cohort_total_pt #> #> 1 comb… Sample A… median_age_cohort_en… Cohort De… -12.0 12 #> 2 comb… Sample A… median_age_first_vis… Cohort De… 1.46 12 #> 3 comb… Sample A… median_all condition… Clinical … 0 12 #> 4 comb… Sample A… median_fu Cohort De… 0 12 #> 5 comb… Sample A… median_outpatient vi… Utilizati… 0 12 #> 6 comb… base_coh… median_age_cohort_en… Cohort De… -12.0 12 #> 7 comb… base_coh… median_age_first_vis… Cohort De… 1.46 12 #> 8 comb… base_coh… median_all condition… Clinical … 0 12 #> 9 comb… base_coh… median_fu Cohort De… 0 12 #> 10 comb… base_coh… median_outpatient vi… Utilizati… 0 12 #> # ℹ 18 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: output_function #> #> $cohort_overlap #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #> site cohort_group group_ct #> #> 1 combined base_cohort&Sample Alternate 12 #> #' Execute `ssc_output` function ssc_output_example <- ssc_output(process_output = ssc_process_example, alt_cohort_filter = 'Sample Alternate') %>% suppressMessages() #> Warning: `aes_string()` was deprecated in ggplot2 3.0.0. #> ℹ Please use tidy evaluation idioms with `aes()`. #> ℹ See also `vignette("ggplot2-in-packages")` for more information. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the UpSetR package. #> Please report the issue to the authors. #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the UpSetR package. #> Please report the issue to the authors. #> Warning: The `size` argument of `element_line()` is deprecated as of ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use the `linewidth` argument instead. #> ℹ The deprecated feature was likely used in the UpSetR package. #> Please report the issue to the authors. ssc_output_example[[1]] ssc_output_example[[2]] #' Easily convert the graph into an interactive ggiraph or plotly object with #' `make_interactive_squba()` make_interactive_squba(ssc_output_example[[2]]) #> Warning: geom_GeomLabel() has yet to be implemented in plotly. #> If you'd like to see this geom implemented, #> Please open an issue with your example code at #> https://github.com/ropensci/plotly/issues #> Warning: geom_GeomLabel() has yet to be implemented in plotly. #> If you'd like to see this geom implemented, #> Please open an issue with your example code at #> https://github.com/ropensci/plotly/issues {"x":{"data":[{"orientation":"v","width":[0,0,0,0,0],"base":[0.55000000000000004,1.55,2.5499999999999998,3.5499999999999998,4.5499999999999998],"x":[0,0,0,0,0],"y":[0.89999999999999991,0.90000000000000013,0.90000000000000036,0.90000000000000036,0.90000000000000036],"text":["diff_base: 0
cf: all conditions
cohort_id: Sample Alternate","diff_base: 0
cf: age cohort entry

title: SSC Demographic Mappings – PCORnet — ssc_pcornet_demographics
text: sample version file structure expected demographic_mappings parameter ssc_process function. user recreate file include clinical concepts.

title: SSC Demographic Mappings – PCORnet — ssc_pcornet_demographics
code: ssc_pcornet_demographics

title: SSC Demographic Mappings – PCORnet — ssc_pcornet_demographics
text: data frame 3 columns demographic string used identify demographic category concept_field name field CDM demographic table containing appropriate demographic information field_values values concept_field represent demographic category

title: SSC Demographic Mappings – PCORnet — ssc_pcornet_demographics
text: parameter left NULL, file OMOP compliment used place custom mappings.

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria — ssc_process
text: plausibility module characterize user-provided base cohort alternate cohort definitions using selection continuous categorical variables. use values compare alternate definition base cohort evaluate changes cohort definition impact patient population. Users option provide definitions several variable types: demographic_mappings: define set demographic variables interest domain_tbl: define domain definitions assess patient fact density + utilization (similar Patient Facts module) specialty_concepts: define set specialty concepts evaluate specialty care sought cohort members outcome_concepts: define study outcome variables Sample versions input files available sensitivityselectioncriteria::. module compatible OMOP PCORnet CDMs based user's selection.

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria — ssc_process
code: ssc_process(   base_cohort,   alt_cohorts,   omop_or_pcornet,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   person_tbl = cdm_tbl("person"),   visit_tbl = cdm_tbl("visit_occurrence"),   provider_tbl = NULL,   care_site_tbl = NULL,   demographic_mappings = NULL,   specialty_concepts = NULL,   outcome_concepts = NULL,   domain_tbl = sensitivityselectioncriteria::ssc_domain_file,   domain_select = sensitivityselectioncriteria::ssc_domain_file %>% distinct(domain)     %>% pull() )

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria — ssc_process
text: base_cohort tabular input || required table representing patients meet base cohort definition, used "gold standard" comparative analyses. table least: site | character | name(s) institutions included cohort person_id / patid | integer / character | patient identifier start_date | date | start cohort period end_date | date | end cohort period Note start end dates included table used limit search window analyses module. alt_cohorts tablular input list tabular inputs || required table list tables (can named unnamed) representing patients meeting alternative cohort definitions, assessed base cohort. tables structure base_cohort. unnamed list provided, numbers assigned cohort definition labeling purposes. named lists, names used label alternate cohorts. omop_or_pcornet string || required string, either omop pcornet, indicating CDM format data omop: run ssc_process_omop() function OMOP CDM instance pcornet: run ssc_process_pcornet() function PCORnet CDM instance multi_or_single_site string || defaults single string, either single multi, indicating whether single-site multi-site analysis executed anomaly_or_exploratory string || defaults exploratory string, either anomaly exploratory, indicating type results produced. Exploratory analyses give high level summary data examine fact representation within cohort. Anomaly detection analyses specialized identify outliers within cohort. person_tbl tabular input || defaults cdm_tbl('person') CDM person demographic table contains basic demographic information (sex, race, etc.) cohort members visit_tbl tabular input || defaults cdm_tbl('visit_occurrence') CDM visit_occurrence, visit_detail, encounter table contains information patients' healthcare encounters provider_tbl tabular input || defaults NULL CDM table provider & provider specialty information. table used specialty_concepts concept set provided. care_site_tbl tabular input || defaults NULL CDM table care site/facility & related specialty information. table used specialty_concepts concept set provided. demographic_mappings tabular input || defaults NULL table defining demographic elements defined. left NULL, default demographic mappings CDM used, can viewed ssc_omop_demographics ssc_pcornet_demographics. different table provided user, definition used instead. table minimally contain: demographic | character | label demographic category (ex: female, asian_race) concept_field | character | field CDM information stored field_values | character | concept concepts used define demographic category specialty_concepts tabular input || defaults NULL concept set concepts representing specialties interest identified cohort. table minimally contain either concept_id field (OMOP) concept_code field (PCORnet) outcome_concepts tabular input || defaults NULL concept set used define relevant outcome variables assessed cohort. input contain one following: concept_id | integer | concept_id interest (required OMOP) concept_code | character | code interest (required PCORnet) : variable | character | string label grouping one concept code larger variable definition domain | character | name CDM table concept can found certain PCORnet applications, also contain vocabulary_id | character | vocabulary code, match listed domain table's vocabulary_field see example file structure, see ?sensitivityselectioncriteria::ssc_outcome_file domain_tbl tabular input || defaults internal ssc_domain_file table CSV file defining domains assessed facts per patient year computations & outcome variables. input contain: domain | character | string label domain domain_tbl | character | name CDM table domain defined concept_field | character| string name field domain table concepts located date_field | character |  name field domain table date used temporal filtering vocabulary_field | character | PCORnet applications, name field domain table vocabulary identifier differentiate concepts one another (ex: dx_type); can set NA OMOP applications filter_logic | character | logic applied domain_tbl order achieve definition interest; written applying dplyr::filter command R see example file structure, see ?sensitivityselectioncriteria::ssc_domain_file domain_select string vector || defaults internal ssc_domain_file domains string vector domain names, matching listed domain_tbl, used computation facts per patient year vector need include domains used computation outcomes, accessed domain_tbl separately

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria — ssc_process
text: function return dataframe summarizing fact demographic distributions provided cohort definitions. detailed description output specific check type, see PEDSpace metadata repository

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria — ssc_process
code:
#' Source setup file source(system.file('setup.R', package = 'sensitivityselectioncriteria')) #' Create in-memory RSQLite database using data in extdata directory conn <- mk_testdb_omop() #' Establish connection to database and generate internal configurations initialize_dq_session(session_name = 'ssc_process_test', working_directory = my_directory, db_conn = conn, is_json = FALSE, file_subdirectory = my_file_folder, cdm_schema = NA) #> Connected to: :memory:@NA #> To see environment settings, run `get_argos_default()` ## silence SQL trace for this example config('db_trace', FALSE) #' Build mock base study cohort base_cohort <- cdm_tbl('person') %>% dplyr::distinct(person_id) %>% dplyr::mutate(start_date = as.Date(-5000), #RSQLite does not store date objects, #hence the numerics end_date = as.Date(15000), site = ifelse(person_id %in% c(1:6), 'synth1', 'synth2')) #' Build mock alternate study cohort alt_cohort <- cdm_tbl('person') %>% dplyr::distinct(person_id) %>% head(100) %>% dplyr::mutate(start_date = as.Date(-5000), #RSQLite does not store date objects, #hence the numerics end_date = as.Date(15000), site = ifelse(person_id %in% c(1:6), 'synth1', 'synth2')) #' Prepare input tables ssc_domain_tbl <- dplyr::tibble(domain = c('all conditions', 'outpatient visits'), domain_tbl = c('condition_occurrence', 'visit_occurrence'), concept_field = c('condition_concept_id', 'visit_concept_id'), date_field = c('condition_start_date', 'visit_start_date'), vocabulary_field = c(NA, NA), filter_logic = c(NA, 'visit_concept_id == 9202')) ssc_outcome_tbl <- read_codeset('dx_hypertension') %>% dplyr::mutate(variable = 'hypertension', domain = 'all conditions') #' Execute `ssc_process` function #' This example will use the single site, exploratory, cross sectional #' configuration ssc_process_example <- ssc_process(base_cohort = base_cohort, alt_cohorts = list('Sample Alternate' = alt_cohort), omop_or_pcornet = 'omop', multi_or_single_site = 'single', anomaly_or_exploratory = 'exploratory', domain_tbl = ssc_domain_tbl, domain_select = c('all conditions', 'outpatient visits'), outcome_concepts = ssc_outcome_tbl) %>% suppressMessages() #> ┌ Output Function Details ──────────────────────────────────────┐ #> │ You can optionally use this dataframe in the accompanying │ #> │ `ssc_output` function. Here are the parameters you will need: │ #> │ │ #> │ Always Required: process_output │ #> │ Required for Check: alt_cohort_filter │ #> │ │ #> │ See ?ssc_output for more details. │ #> └───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ssc_process_example #> $summary_values #> # A tibble: 28 × 7 #> site cohort_id cohort_characteristic fact_group fact_summary cohort_total_pt #> #> 1 comb… Sample A… median_age_cohort_en… Cohort De… -12.0 12 #> 2 comb… Sample A… median_age_first_vis… Cohort De… 1.46 12 #> 3 comb… Sample A… median_all condition… Clinical … 0 12 #> 4 comb… Sample A… median_fu Cohort De… 0 12 #> 5 comb… Sample A… median_outpatient vi… Utilizati… 0 12 #> 6 comb… base_coh… median_age_cohort_en… Cohort De… -12.0 12 #> 7 comb… base_coh… median_age_first_vis… Cohort De… 1.46 12 #> 8 comb… base_coh… median_all condition… Clinical … 0 12 #> 9 comb… base_coh… median_fu Cohort De… 0 12 #> 10 comb… base_coh… median_outpatient vi… Utilizati… 0 12 #> # ℹ 18 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: output_function #> #> $cohort_overlap #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #> site cohort_group group_ct #> #> 1 combined base_cohort&Sample Alternate 12 #> #' Execute `ssc_output` function ssc_output_example <- ssc_output(process_output = ssc_process_example, alt_cohort_filter = 'Sample Alternate') %>% suppressMessages() ssc_output_example[[1]] ssc_output_example[[2]] #' Easily convert the graph into an interactive ggiraph or plotly object with #' `make_interactive_squba()` make_interactive_squba(ssc_output_example[[2]]) #> Warning: geom_GeomLabel() has yet to be implemented in plotly. #> If you'd like to see this geom implemented, #> Please open an issue with your example code at #> https://github.com/ropensci/plotly/issues #> Warning: geom_GeomLabel() has yet to be implemented in plotly. #> If you'd like to see this geom implemented, #> Please open an issue with your example code at #> https://github.com/ropensci/plotly/issues {"x":{"data":[{"orientation":"v","width":[0,0,0,0,0],"base":[0.55000000000000004,1.55,2.5499999999999998,3.5499999999999998,4.5499999999999998],"x":[0,0,0,0,0],"y":[0.89999999999999991,0.90000000000000013,0.90000000000000036,0.90000000000000036,0.90000000000000036],"text":["diff_base: 0
cf: all conditions

what: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – OMOP — ssc_process_omop
title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – OMOP — ssc_process_omop
text: Sensitivity Selection Criteria – OMOP

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – OMOP — ssc_process_omop
code: ssc_process_omop(   base_cohort,   alt_cohorts,   multi_or_single_site = "single",   anomaly_or_exploratory = "exploratory",   person_tbl = cdm_tbl("person"),   visit_tbl = cdm_tbl("visit_occurrence"),   provider_tbl = cdm_tbl("provider"),   care_site_tbl = cdm_tbl("care_site"),   demographic_mappings = sensitivityselectioncriteria::ssc_omop_demographics,   specialty_concepts = NULL,   outcome_concepts = NULL,   domain_tbl = sensitivityselectioncriteria::ssc_domain_file,   domain_select = sensitivityselectioncriteria::ssc_domain_file %>% distinct(domain)     %>% pull() )

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – OMOP — ssc_process_omop
text: base_cohort dataframe including patients meet base cohort definition columns site | person_id | start_date | end_date alt_cohorts list named list dataframes patients meeting alternative cohort definitions; names provided, numbers assigned cohort definition labelling purposes multi_or_single_site direction determine kind check run string either multi single anomaly_or_exploratory direction determine kind check run; string either anomaly exploratory person_tbl CDM person table visit_tbl CDM visit_occurrence table provider_tbl CDM table provider & provider specialty information used specialty_concepts provided provider_tbl & care_site_tbl null, provider specialty prioritized care_site_tbl CDM table care site / facility & care site / facility specialty information used specialty_concepts provided provider_tbl & care_site_tbl null, provider specialty prioritized demographic_mappings table defining demographic elements defined NULL, default demographic mappings CDM used (ssc_omop_demographics) otherwise, user provided table used specialty_concepts concept set provider specialty concepts interest used identify specialty visits outcome_concepts concept set following columns: concept_id | concept_code | concept_name | vocabulary_id | variable | domain   domain_tbl table domain definitions following columns: domain, domain_tbl, concept_field, date_field, filter_logic domain_select vector domain names used computation facts per domain per year follow
code: where domain matches a domain listed in the `domain_defs` table this vector does NOT need to include domains used in the computation for                  outcomes, as those will be accessed from the table directly

title: Sensitivity to Selection Criteria – OMOP — ssc_process_omop
text: dataframe summarizing fact demographic distributions provided cohort definitions; anomaly detection outputs, standardized mean difference base cohort alternate cohort definition computed variables interest
